    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        @GetMapping("/image/{fileName}")
public void getImage​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                     @PathVariable
                     java.lang.String fileName)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Get a stored image by its name. Will first search the class path of the project for the file, if not found will then search the file system of the server. Returns the image requested in the http body, media type is image/jpg
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to retrieve, passed in as a path variable
        Throws:
        CarbonFileNotFoundException - if the image could not be found.
        java.io.IOException

      • saveImage

        @PostMapping({"/image/{fileName}","/image/"})
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> saveImage​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                        @RequestParam("image")
                                                                        org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file,
                                                                        @PathVariable
                                                                        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> fileName)
        Save an image to the server's file system. Pass the image as a form-data, with key "image" and value as the file. Max image size is 10MB.
        Parameters:
        file - The image to upload, pass as a multi-part file as form data, max size of 10MB
        fileName - optional file name passed as a path variable, if omitted will use file name from passed in file
        Returns:
        the result of the upload wrapped in a map, the key is message.
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - if user is not authenticated as at least a creator

      • deleteImage

        @DeleteMapping("/image/{fileName}")
public void deleteImage​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                        @PathVariable
                        java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Delete a stored image by its name. Will first search the class path of the project for the file, if not found will then search the file system of the server.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to retrieve, passed in as a path variable
        Throws:
        CarbonFileNotFoundException - if the image could not be found.
        java.io.IOException

      • addNews

        @PostMapping("/news/add")
public News addNews​(@RequestBody
                    News news)
        Add a news item to the database. Must be authenticated as at least a creator. Required fields: title, imageTitle, link, body Optional fields: date(defaults to today)
        Parameters:
        news - The news item to add to the database, passed in as a JSON object.
        Returns:
        The news object that was just added as a JSON object.

      • getNewsByTitle

        @GetMapping("/news/{title}")
public News getNewsByTitle​(@PathVariable
                           java.lang.String title)
        Find a news item by its title. If no item is found, returns null
        Parameters:
        title - The title to search by, passed in as a path variable
        Returns:
        A news object as a JSON object or null

      • deleteNewsByTitle

        @DeleteMapping("/news/{title}")
public News deleteNewsByTitle​(@PathVariable
                              java.lang.String title)
        Deletes a news item by its title. Must be authenticated as at least a creator.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to search by, passed in as a path variable
        Returns:
        The news item that was delete if successful

      • getNewsAfterDate

        @GetMapping("/news/after/{date}")
public java.util.List<News> getNewsAfterDate​(@PathVariable
                                             java.lang.String date)
        Get all news objects that have a date after the date passed in. List is sorted by date past to present.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to search by, passed as a path variable in the from of "yyyy-MM-dd"
        Returns:
        A list of news objects, (can be empty) as a JSON array

      • getLastNNews

        @GetMapping("/news/last/{n}")
public java.util.List<News> getLastNNews​(@PathVariable
                                         int n)
        Get the most recent n news objects in the database. If less than n items exist in the database, returns as many as possible. List is sorted by date past to present.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of news objects to get passed in as a path variable.
        Returns:
        A list of news objects that is up to n in size as a JSON array.

      • getAllNews

        @GetMapping("/news/all")
public java.util.List<News> getAllNews()
        Get all news objects in the database. List is sorted by date past to present.
        Returns:
        A list of news objects as a JSON array
